entities.description: The total number of valid cases in the dataset.
The frequency of cases without applying any weighting adjustments.
The percentage of total cases that fall into each category.
Specific categories of cases, such as different offense segments or age groups.
Various statistical measures calculated from the data, such as mean, median, mode, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation.
The type of variable, such as numeric.
Indicator of missing values in the dataset.
The position of the data within the dataset, including its width and decimal specifics.
Specific segments related to offenses recorded in the survey.
Specific segments related to victims recorded in the survey.

relationships.description: Indicates the total number of valid cases in the dataset.
Defines the unweighted frequency of cases for each category.
Defines the percentage of total cases for each category.
Includes various statistical measures related to the dataset.
Defines the type of variables in the dataset.
Indicates the presence of and details about missing values in the dataset.
Provides the location details of the data within the dataset.
Indicates segments related to offenses in the survey.
Indicates segments related to victims in the survey.
